title: Train in Oaxaca derails killing 13 and injuring 98 people
snippets: Mexico's Navy says the train was carrying 250 people when it derailed partially near the town of Nizanda in Oaxaca.
The train was carrying around 250 passengers and crew members on a cross-country route linking the Pacific and the Gulf of Mexico. Nearly 100 people were injured.

The governor of Oaxaca, Salomon Jara Cruz, expressed condolences to the families of those killed in the accident and said state authorities were co-ordinating with federal agencies to assist those affected.
The Interoceanic Train linking the states of Oaxaca and Veracruz derailed as it passed a curve near the town of Nizanda.
Mexico's President Claudia Sheinbaum said more than 90 others were injured, some of whom remained in critical condition. An investigation is now underway.

summary: A passenger train on the Interoceanic route linking Oaxaca and Veracruz derailed near Nizanda, Oaxaca, on December 29, 2025. According to President Claudia Sheinbaum, 13 people were killed and 98 injured, with some in critical condition. The train was carrying about 250 passengers and crew. Authorities are assisting victims, and an investigation into the cause is underway.

The exercises, described by Beijing as a warning against “Taiwan independence” and foreign interference, follow the announcement of a major U.S. arms sale to Taiwan and comments from Japan’s prime minister about possible intervention. constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.60 (<20 tokens)
summary: China’s seaborne imports of liquefied natural gas are projected to increase slightly in December 2025, following a significant rise in November, according to Kpler data. The increase is attributed to buyers securing more cargoes through long-term contracts.

title: Accounting group says exams must be taken in person in 2025
snippets: Decision follows scandals at Big Four and comes as AI tools make it easier to circumvent invigilators

Candidates will have to sit assessments in person unless there are exceptional circumstances, says ACCA Business live – latest updates The world’s largest accounting body is to stop students being allowed to take exams remotely to crack down on a rise in cheating on tests that underpin professional
titles: Accounting body scraps remote exams to combat cheating
UK accounting body to halt remote exams amid AI cheating
constructiveness_reason: semantic: pos_sim=0.00, neg_sim=0.00; length_penalty=0.35 (<12 tokens)
summary: The Association of Chartered Certified Accountants (ACCA), the world's largest accounting body, will require candidates to sit exams in person starting in 2025. This decision follows scandals at major accounting firms and concerns that AI tools have made it easier to cheat during remote assessments. Exceptions will be made only for exceptional circumstances.

title: Man accused of killing nine people near Paramaribo in Suriname
snippets: Nine killed, including five children, in Suriname attack Reuters
Police accused a 42-year-old man of killing at least 9 people outside the capitol of Paramaribo, just days after Christmas.
titles: Nine killed, including five children, in Suriname attack - Reuters
Man kills at least 9, including his children, in Suriname stabbing, police say
constructiveness_reason: This story reports a tragic event but does not provide any actionable insights, solutions, or in-depth understanding of the context or causes. It only offers basic awareness of the event.
summary: A 42-year-old man has been accused by police of killing at least nine people, including five children, near Paramaribo, Suriname, just days after Christmas. Authorities are investigating the incident, which occurred outside the capital. The suspect is in custody, and no motive has been released.

title: Ukraine gives new peace plan as talks with Russia continue
snippets: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine brings a revised 20-point peace proposal, as well as doubts about whether Russia is serious about pursuing peace.
The U.S. president said after a meeting at Mar-a-Lago that a deal was “maybe very close.” But a joint U.S.-Ukraine proposal appeared unfinished, as Russia rejected several ideas.
titles: Zelensky to Meet With Trump at Mar-a-Lago About Plan to End War With Russia
Trump and Zelensky Meet to Iron Out Peace Plan, but Deal Remains Elusive
constructiveness_reason: This story informs about a significant diplomatic meeting and implies a potential solution to a major conflict. However, without more detail on the plan or the context of the conflict, the story falls short of fully empowering the reader with knowledge.
summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has presented a revised 20-point peace proposal amid ongoing doubts about Russia’s willingness to negotiate. After a meeting at Mar-a-Lago, the U.S. president stated a deal was “maybe very close,” but the joint U.S.-Ukraine proposal remains incomplete, with Russia rejecting several key points. Negotiations are ongoing.
